extends java.lang.Object

        Asks the given server for all of the CQ Packages that it has, returning their information.
        Returns:
        null only if the server timed out (in which case "active" is disabled on the passed serverConfig)

      • uploadPackage

        public Status uploadPackage(SlingPackageSupportFactory factory)
        Uploads the Package for the current Project to all the servers.
        Parameters:
        factory - strategy for creating SlingPackageSupport instances
        Returns:
        the "aggregated" status: Status.OK, PackageStatus.UNRESOLVED_DEPENDENCIES or PackageStatus.NO_PACKAGE

      • startInactiveBundles

        public com.twcable.gradle.http.HttpResponse startInactiveBundles()
        Calls startInactiveBundles(SlingSupport) for each server in SlingServersConfiguration
        Returns:
        the "aggregate" HTTP response: if all the calls are in the >= 200 and <400 range, or a 408 (timeout, server not running) the returns an empty HTTP_OK; otherwise returns the first error response it came across

      • isBadResponse

        public static boolean isBadResponse(int respCode,
                                    boolean missingIsOk)
        Does the given http code indicate there was an error?

        Good codes are 200 - 399. However, 408 (client timeout) is also not considered to be an error.

        Parameters:
        respCode - the code to check if it indicates an error or not
        missingIsOk - is a 404 (missing) acceptable?

      • startInactiveBundles

        public static com.twcable.gradle.http.HttpResponse startInactiveBundles(com.twcable.gradle.sling.SlingSupport slingSupport)
        For the server pointed to by "slingSupport" this asks the server for all of its bundles. For every bundle that is RESOLVED, this will call "start" on it.
        Returns:
        the "aggregate" HTTP response: if all the calls are in the >= 200 and <400 range, or a 408 (timeout, server not running) the returns an empty HTTP_OK; otherwise returns the first error response it came across

      • getBundlesControlUri

        public static java.net.URI getBundlesControlUri(com.twcable.gradle.sling.SlingServerConfiguration serverConf)
        Returns the URL to use to do actions on bundles.

      • validateBundles

        public com.twcable.gradle.http.HttpResponse validateBundles(org.gradle.api.artifacts.Configuration configuration)
        Calls validateAllBundles(Collection, SlingSupport) for each server in SlingServersConfiguration and all the bundles in the configuration
        Parameters:
        configuration - the Gradle Configuration such as "compile" to retrieve the list of bundles from
        Returns:
        HTTP_INTERNAL_ERROR if there are inactive bundles, otherwise the "aggregate" HTTP response: if all the calls are in the >= 200 and <400 range, or a 408 (timeout, server not running) the returns an empty HTTP_OK; otherwise returns the first error response it came across

      • validateBundles

        public com.twcable.gradle.http.HttpResponse validateBundles(org.gradle.api.file.FileCollection files)
        Calls validateAllBundles(Collection, SlingSupport) for each server in SlingServersConfiguration and all the bundles
        Parameters:
        files - the list of bundles
        Returns:
        HTTP_INTERNAL_ERROR if there are inactive bundles, otherwise the "aggregate" HTTP response: if all the calls are in the >= 200 and <400 range, or a 408 (timeout, server not running) the returns an empty HTTP_OK; otherwise returns the first error response it came across

      • validateRemoteBundles

        public com.twcable.gradle.http.HttpResponse validateRemoteBundles()
        Calls validateAllBundles(Collection, SlingSupport) for each server in SlingServersConfiguration and all the bundles in the package file downloaded from that server
        Returns:
        HTTP_INTERNAL_ERROR if there are inactive bundles, otherwise the "aggregate" HTTP response: if all the calls are in the >= 200 and <400 range, or a 408 (timeout, server not running) the returns an empty HTTP_OK; otherwise returns the first error response it came across

      • validateAllBundles

        public static com.twcable.gradle.http.HttpResponse validateAllBundles(@Nullable java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> symbolicNames,
                                                                      com.twcable.gradle.sling.SlingSupport slingSupport)
        Calls each server in SlingServersConfiguration and all the bundles in 'symbolicNames' to verify that they are not in non-ACTIVE states. If there are, it returns HTTP_INTERNAL_ERROR (500).
        Parameters:
        symbolicNames - the symbolic names to check; if null then all bundles on the server are checked
        slingSupport - the server association to user
        Returns:
        HTTP_INTERNAL_ERROR if there are inactive bundles, otherwise the "aggregate" HTTP response: if all the calls are in the >= 200 and <400 range, or a 408 (timeout, server not running) the returns an empty HTTP_OK; otherwise returns the first error response it came across

      • uninstallBundles

        public com.twcable.gradle.http.HttpResponse uninstallBundles(CqPackageHelper.UninstallBundlePredicate bundlePredicate)
        Calls uninstallAllBundles(List, SlingSupport, UninstallBundlePredicate) for each server in SlingServersConfiguration and all the bundles in the package file downloaded from that server
        Returns:
        the "aggregate" HTTP response: if all the calls are in the >= 200 and <400 range, or a 404 (not installed) or a 408 (timeout, server not running) the returns an empty HTTP_OK; otherwise returns the first error response it came across

      • uninstallAllBundles

        public com.twcable.gradle.http.HttpResponse uninstallAllBundles(java.util.List<java.lang.String> symbolicNames,
                                                                com.twcable.gradle.sling.SlingSupport slingSupport,
                                                                @Nullable CqPackageHelper.UninstallBundlePredicate predicate)
        Given a list of symbolic names on a server, uninstalls them if they match the predicate
        Parameters:
        symbolicNames - the symbolic names on a server to check against
        slingSupport - the SlingSupport for a particular server
        predicate - the predicate determine if the bundle should be uninstalled
        Returns:
        the "aggregate" HTTP response: if all the calls are in the >= 200 and <400 range, or a 404 (not installed) or a 408 (timeout, server not running) the returns an empty HTTP_OK; otherwise returns the first error response it came across

        public static @Nullable java.lang.String getSymbolicName(java.io.File file)
                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Get the OSGi bundle symbolic name from the file's metadata.
        Returns:
        null if the file is not an OSGi bundle
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
